items.title: Vintage chocolate chip cookies
items.description: An easy chocolate chip cookie recipe for soft biscuits with a squidgy middle that will impress family and friends. Make plenty as they're sure to be a hit

image.alt: Chocolate chip cookies on a plate with a small glass bottle of milk
image.title: Vintage chocolate chip cookies

items.title: Chewy chocolate chip cookies
items.description: Bake a batch of chewy chocolate chip cookies with this quick and easy recipe. Barney Desmazery shows us how in this step-by-step video guide.

image.alt: Chocolate chip cookies on a wire rack

items.title: Double choc peanut butter cookies
items.description: What could be better with a glass of cold milk than a warm, gooey peanut butter cookie? These choc chunk treats are topped with crunchy chopped peanuts

items.title: Oaty hazelnut cookies
items.description: Soft and slightly chewy, these oaty cookies contain apple and maple syrup instead of sugar. They're packed with hazelnuts which are a good source of vitamins and minerals

items.title: Red velvet cookies
items.description: Turn the popular cake into chewy cookies, complete with cream cheese icing. Box them up to give as a gift, or make a batch of dough to keep in the freezer

image.alt: Red velvet cookies served on a wire tray
image.title: Red velvet cookies

items.title: Easy chocolate chip cookies
items.description: Learn how to make classic chocolate chip cookies and enjoy them still warm from the oven. Perfect for a bake sale or with your afternoon tea.

image.alt: Chocolate chunk cookie on a pale grey work surface
image.title: Easy chocolate chip cookies

items.title: Basic cookies
items.description: Bake a batch of these easy cookies with just five ingredients – or fewer. A perfect partner to a cup of tea, you can whip them up in no time

image.alt: Basic cookies on a wire rack
image.title: Basic cookies

items.title: Sugar cookies
items.description: Decorate our buttery, melt-in-the-mouth sugar cookies with piped icing and sprinkles for extra special festive biscuits. They make lovely Christmas gifts

image.alt: A selection of festive sugar cookies
image.title: Sugar cookies

items.title: Vegan chocolate chip cookies
items.description: Try our best ever vegan chocolate chip cookies. Non-vegans will be hard pressed to notice the difference between these and their favourite choc chip biscuits

image.alt: Vegan chocolate chip cookies served on a tray
image.title: Vegan chocolate chip cookies

items.title: Double-dipped shortbread cookies
items.description: What could be better than shortbread biscuits? Shortbread double-dipped in milk and white chocolate! They're sure to go down a storm with family and friends

image.alt: Double-dipped shortbread cookies on a wire rack
image.title: Double-dipped shortbread cookies

items.title: Gingerbread cookies
items.description: Put your feet up and enjoy these moreish gingerbread cookies with a cuppa, made with aromatic cloves, ginger, cinnamon and rich black treacle

image.alt: Gingerbread cookies served on a wire tray
image.title: Gingerbread cookies

items.title: Christmas crinkle cookies
items.description: Love crinkle cookies? Try our extra-festive version for Christmas, with orange zest, mixed spice and cinnamon – and not forgetting the classic fudgy centre

image.alt: Christmas crinkle cookies on a baking tray
image.title: Christmas crinkle cookies

items.title: Next level chocolate chip cookies
items.description: Forget brittle packet versions and make these ultimate choc chip cookies. Expect a crisp exterior, chewy middle and chunks of gooey dark chocolate

image.alt: Three rows of chocolate chip cookies
image.title: Next level chocolate chip cookies

items.title: Cookie dough pizza
items.description: We've seen pizza in all sorts of varieties, but this has to be our favourite. Top your cookie dough pizza base with any treats that take your fancy

items.title: Chocolate & hazelnut thumbprint cookies
items.description: The food processor does most of the work in this cookie recipe, but younger children will enjoy rolling the dough into balls and thumbprinting. Older kids can make them on their own

items.title: Double ginger cookies
items.description: If you love ginger nuts, you'll love these American-style spiced biscuits with chunks of stem ginger, dipped in dark chocolate

items.title: Giant cookie
items.description: Get baking with the kids who'll love this giant cookie that they can adapt with their favourite treats like marshmallows, pretzels, nuts, toffee or fudge

image.alt: A pan serving a giant cookie
image.title: Giant kids-can-make cookie

items.title: Hazelnut & chocolate cookie sandwiches
items.description: How do you make chocolate chip cookies even better? Stuff them with chocolate! These hazelnut & chocolate cookie sandwiches are the ultimate indulgence

image.alt: Hazelnut & chocolate cookie sandwiches on a wire tray
image.title: Hazelnut & chocolate cookie sandwiches

items.title: Choc chunk, cashew & cranberry cookies
items.description: These nutty biscuits are packed with chocolate chunks and chewy dried fruit - swap the cashews for peanuts if you prefer

items.title: Chilli chocolate cookies
items.description: A big pile of spiced double chocolate chip biscuits next to a tub of ice cream is an easy way to feed a crowd

items.title: Peanut butter cookies
items.description: With just three ingredients, these simple peanut butter cookies will delight kids and grown-ups alike – and they're gluten-free, too

items.title: Sugar-dusted wedding cookies
items.description: An English, shortbread-based version of the classic Mexican wedding cookie - perfect for homemade wedding favours

items.title: Rainbow cookies
items.description: These colourful cookies are bound to be a big hit with kids and adults alike

items.title: Macadamia & cranberry American cookies
items.description: These freezable biscuits are completely irresistible and make a great gift for kids to give to teachers or grandparents

items.title: Triple chocolate cookies
items.description: You've got all bases covered with white, milk and dark chocolate in these American-style cookies, best enjoyed warm with a cold glass of milk

items.title: Chocolate chunk pecan cookies
items.description: You can't beat American-style cookies with big chunks of chocolate and nuts. The perfect grown-up biscuit

image.title: Chocolate chunk pecan cookies with a bow

items.title: Gooey chocolate cherry cookies
items.description: If you like American-style cookies, you’ll love these pale, chewy delights. Plus, they can be baked from frozen

items.title: Bumper oat cookies
items.description: Oaty, chewy, spicy cookies - ready in under an hour and great for tea time

items.title: Fruity flapjack cookies
items.description: Toast oats before mixing them into the dough to make these fruity cookies, a delicious hybrid of syrupy flapjacks and coconut macaroons

image.alt: Fruity flapjack cookies on a wire rack
image.title: Fruity flapjack cookies

items.title: Chocolate cookies
items.description: Bake a batch of our irresistible all-American chocolate chunk cookies to enjoy with your cuppa. These easy sweet treats are ideal for weekend baking.

image.alt: All-American chocolate chunk cookies on wire rack
image.title: Chocolate cookies

items.title: Forgotten cookies
items.description: What's in a name? Pop these in the oven, forget about them overnight, and you'll have crumbly cookies in the morning

items.title: Christmas cookies
items.description: These festive vanilla cookies make a beautiful edible Christmas tree decoration. Or, you could pack them into boxes to give as end-of-term gifts for teachers and friends.

items.title: Toffee apple cookies
items.description: These are truly delicious – crunchy round the edges, chewy in the centre

items.title: Norwegian butter cookies
items.description: Enjoy these traditional Norwegian butter cookies at Christmas as a treat for family and friends. They’re quick to make, and taste delicious

image.alt: Norwegian butter cookies served in a star shaped dish
image.title: Norwegian butter cookies

items.title: Red Nose Day raspberry cookies
items.description: Raise some money for Comic Relief with these cheeky cookies.

items.title: Fruity cookies
items.description: This easy yet delicious recipe was whipped up by the Year 7 pupils from the Priory School in Suffolk

items.title: Orange pumpkin face cookies
items.description: Great fun biscuits for trick or treaters - make a day or two ahead, then fill in before your spooky guests arrive

items.title: Anzac biscuits
items.description: These iconic biscuits were originally made to send to the ANZACs (Australian and New Zealand Army Corps) serving in Gallipoli

items.title: Blueberry & pecan oaties
items.description: Make double the quantity of this fruity cookie dough and freeze, so delicious home-baked biscuits are always close at hand

items.title: Sugar-dusted vanilla shortbread
items.description: Great for keeping the biscuit tin topped up over Christmas, these sweet shortbread thins make a perfect treat

items.title: Freezer biscuits
items.description: Everyone needs a treat now and again! These oat-packed biscuits are designed to be stored in the freezer – simply bake when the mood strikes

items.title: Cherry & coconut Florentines
items.description: Cute chewy bites. Make one giant version, then stamp out the star shapes - leaving lots of bits to nibble!

items.title: Oatmeal raisin cookies
items.description: Fill the biscuit tin with these rustic cookies. Soaking the raisins gives a boost to the texture and stops them from burning during cooking

items.title: Mango crunch cookies
items.description: Little hands can help make these fruity biscuits topped with icing and sprinkles. It's an ideal way to get kids in the kitchen

items.title: Blueberry & pretzel cookies
items.description: Chewy, crunchy, salty and sweet- these biscuits have it all, including some white chocolate chips thrown in for good measure

items.title: Show your spots cookie sandwiches
items.description: These dinky biscuits, stacked with buttercream and topped with Smarties, are perfect for bake sales and cooking with kids

items.title: Clove sugar cookies
items.description: These sweet, nutty, spiced biscuits can be served after dinner, or packaged up as gifts for family and friends

items.title: Black tahini chocolate cookies
items.description: Make your own tahini using black or white sesame seeds, this recipe shows you how. Black ones have a nuttier, sweeter flavour, making them perfect for baking

items.title: Butterscotch cookies
items.description: Hidden rice puffs give reader Pamela Johnson's butterscotch chocolate chip biscuits a good crunch

items.title: Coconut cookies
items.description: Make these coconut cookies for the perfect pick-me-up. They're coated in luxurious dark chocolate and toasted coconut sprinkles

items.title: Vegan gingerbread cookies
items.description: Switch the butter for coconut oil, eggs for chia and use chickpea water in royal icing to make these easy, totally vegan Christmas gingerbread biscuits

items.title: Raspberry, almond & oat breakfast cookies
items.description: Grab a few of these energy-boosting cookies for a quick breakfast, or offer as snacks to bridge the hunger gap before dinner. Enjoy with yogurt and fruit

image.alt: Raspberry, almond & oat breakfast cookies served on a plate
image.title: Raspberry, almond & oat breakfast cookies

items.title: Mince pie cookies
items.description: Love mince pies? Be sure to add these festive biscuits to your Christmas baking list, combining cookies with mincemeat, dark chocolate and cinnamon flavours

image.alt: A selection of mince pie cookies
image.title: Mince pie cookies

items.title: Caramelised honey and tahini cookies
items.description: Use up that jar of sesame paste in the back of your cupboard to bake these decadent honey and tahini biscuits. They’re sweet, salty and totally addictive

image.alt: Caramelised honey and tahini cookies on a wire rack
image.title: Caramelised honey and tahini cookies

items.title: Peanut butter cookie cups
items.description: Pair the winning combination of peanut butter and dark chocolate in these cookie cups. They're perfect for a picnic or pick-me-up treat for the whole family

image.alt: Peanut butter cookie cups at a picnic
image.title: Peanut butter cookie cups

items.title: Easter egg cookies
items.description: Create the perfect cookie with a soft, chewy centre and crisp outer edge. Mini eggs, white and dark chocolate chunks make them an indulgent Easter treat

image.alt: Easter egg cookies displayed in a circle
image.title: Easter egg cookies

items.title: Mincemeat cookies
items.description: Use up a jar of mincemeat to make these festive cookies. They're a perfect addition to a Christmas dessert spread, or a great gift

image.alt: Mincemeat cookies served on a wire tray
image.title: Mincemeat cookies

items.title: Easy Halloween cookies
items.description: Get the kids excited for Halloween with these spooky bat and spider cookies. Complete with 'squashed flies' made from chocolate chips, they'll be a big hit

items.title: Snow globe cookies
items.description: Make these edible snow globes as pretty decorations for your Christmas tree – your fairy lights will shine through the middles, making them look magical!

image.alt: A selection of snow globe cookies
image.title: Snow globe cookies

items.title: Rye Christmas pudding cookies
items.description: Transform leftover Christmas pud into these moreish cookies. Even pudding sceptics will be swayed by these soft, buttery rye cookies which taste of Christmas

image.alt: Two rye Christmas pudding cookies with cream
image.title: Rye Christmas pudding cookies

items.title: Jammy star cookies
items.description: Bake these lovely star-shaped biscuits to give as edible Christmas gifts for family and friends. They're easy to make, so kids can get involved too

image.alt: Jammy star cookies served on a cake stand
image.title: Jammy star cookies
